sysVar.name: HCbias
sysVar.description: Control signal to the heating coil valve if there is no difference between the set-point and the actual value of the supply air temperature. The signal to the valve can be forced by setting the gains to zero and setting the bias to the desired output

sysVar.name: HCfr
sysVar.description: Specifies whether the heating coil control is forward acting (1) or reverse acting (0). If the control is forward acting, the valve opens when the supply air temperature needs to increase, which is what is required for a heating coil.

sysVar.name: HCKd
sysVar.description: Derivative gain

sysVar.name: HCKi
sysVar.description: Determines how quickly the control signal changes in response to a persistent difference between the set-point and the actual value of the supply air temperature. The larger the Integral gain, the faster the control signal changes.

sysVar.name: HCKp
sysVar.description: Proportional gain determines the size of the immediate response of the control signal to a difference between the set-point and the actual value of the supply air temperature. The larger the Proportional Gain, the larger the change in the control signal.

sysVar.name: HCmLiqOpen
sysVar.display_name: Heating Coil Maximum Water Flow Rate
sysVar.description: Water flow rate through the heating coil when the control valve is fully open

sysVar.name: HCStatus
sysVar.description: Heating coil running status (on/off)

sysVar.name: HCTLiqEnt
sysVar.description: Temperature of water entering the heating coil

sysVar.name: HCUA
sysVar.description: Heating coil overall heat transfer coefficient (U) x heating coil area (A) - determined from rated duty and rated log mean temperature difference from manufacturer's data

sysVar.name: HCBootLeakage
sysVar.description: Percentage of air pressure lost for pneumatic control valve. Valve is normally open, so the boot leakage percentage is the minimum possible valve position.

sysVar.name: HCFouledCoil
sysVar.description: Percentage of heat exchange capacity reduced by coil fouling

sysVar.name: HCObstructedPipe
sysVar.display_name: Obstructed Pipe in Heating Coil Circuit
sysVar.description: Percentage reduction of the open valve water flow due to the obstruction. The obstruction is in series with the pump, not in the coil branch or the bypass branch.

sysVar.name: HCUndersizedCoil
sysVar.description: Undersized Coil

sysVar.name: HCDriftedsensor
sysVar.display_name: Supply Air Temperature Sensor Out of Calibration
sysVar.description: Calibration error in supply air temperature sensor

sysVar.name: HCSensorOffset
sysVar.description: Supply air temperature sensor offset

sysVar.name: HCLeakyValve
sysVar.description: Effective valve stem position (percent open) due to leakage when commanded fully closed

sysVar.name: HCOversizedValve
sysVar.description: Ratio of the Cv (or Kv) of the oversized valve to the Cv (or Kv) of a correctly sized valve.

sysVar.name: HCStuckValve
sysVar.description: The position at which the control valve stem is stuck.

sysVar.name: HCmAirEnt
sysVar.description: Air flow rate through the heating coil

sysVar.name: HCmAirLvg
sysVar.description: Air flow rate leaving the Heating Coil

sysVar.name: HCmLiqbypass
sysVar.display_name: Heating Coil Bypass Water Flow Rate
sysVar.description: Water flow rate that bypasses the heating coil rather than flowing through it

sysVar.name: HCmLiqEnt
sysVar.description: Water flow rate through the heating coil

sysVar.name: HCmLiqEntValve
sysVar.display_name: Heating Coil Primary Water Flow Rate
sysVar.description: Water flow rate through the common port of the three port control valve, equal to the sum of the coil water flow rate and the bypass water flow rate

sysVar.name: HCmLiqLvg
sysVar.description: Water flow rate leaving the Heating Coil (and before reaching the 3-way valve)

sysVar.name: HCmLiqLvgValve
sysVar.description: Water flow rate leaving the Heating Coil 3-way valve (and returning back to the hot water system)

sysVar.name: HCpos
sysVar.description: Demanded position of heating coil control valve actuator, in the range 0-1.

sysVar.name: HCposReal
sysVar.description: Actual position of the heating coil control valve, in the range 0-1

sysVar.name: HCq
sysVar.description: Rate of heat transfer from water to air in the coil

sysVar.name: HCTAirEnt
sysVar.description: Dry bulb temperature of the air entering the heating coil

sysVar.name: HCTAirLvg
sysVar.description: Dry bulb temperature of the air leaving the heating coil

sysVar.name: HCTLiqbypass
sysVar.description: Temperature of water by-passing the heating coil

sysVar.name: HCTLiqEntValve
sysVar.description: Water Temperature entering 3-way valve (returning from Heating Coil)

sysVar.name: HCTLiqLvg
sysVar.description: Temperature of water leaving the heating coil (after the coil and before the 3-way valve)

sysVar.name: HCTLiqLvgValve
sysVar.display_name: Heating Coil Valve Leaving Water Temperature
sysVar.description: Temperature of water leaving 3-port control valve and returning to hot water system

sysVar.name: HCTp
sysVar.description: Supply air temperature sensor reading

sysVar.name: HCTs
sysVar.description: Supply air temperature set-point, applied to heating coil control loop

sysVar.name: HCTwAirEnt
sysVar.display_name: Heating Coil Entering Air Wet Bulb Temperature
sysVar.description: Wet bulb temperature of air entering heating coil

sysVar.name: HCTwAirLvg
sysVar.display_name: Heating Coil Leaving Air Wet Bulb Temperature
sysVar.description: Wet bulb temperature of the air leaving the heating coil

sysVar.name: HCwAirEnt
sysVar.display_name: Heating Coil Entering Air Humidity Ratio
sysVar.description: Humidity ratio of air entering heating coil

sysVar.name: HCwAirLvg
sysVar.display_name: Heating Coil Leaving Air Humidity Ratio
sysVar.description: Humidity ratio of air leaving heating coil

sysVar.name: CCbias
sysVar.description: Control signal to the cooling coil valve if there is no difference between the set-point and the actual value of the supply air temperature. The signal to the valve can be forced by setting the gains to zero and setting the bias to the desired output

sysVar.name: CCfr
sysVar.description: Controller is forward acting (1) or reverse acting (0)

sysVar.name: CCKd
sysVar.description: Derivative gain

sysVar.name: CCKi
sysVar.description: Determines how quickly the control signal changes in response to a persistent difference between the set-point and the actual value of the supply air temperature. The larger the Integral Gain, the faster the control signal changes.

sysVar.name: CCKp
sysVar.description: Proportional gain determines the size of the immediate response of the control signal to a difference between the set-point and the actual value of the supply air temperature. The larger the Proportional Gain, the larger the change in the control signal.

sysVar.name: CCmLiqOpen
sysVar.display_name: Cooling Coil Maximum Water Flow Rate
sysVar.description: Water flow rate through the cooling coil when the control valve is fully open

sysVar.name: CCStatus
sysVar.description: Cooling coil running status (on/off)

sysVar.name: CCTLiqEnt
sysVar.description: Temperature of water entering the cooling coil

sysVar.name: CCUA
sysVar.description: Cooling coil overall heat transfer coefficient (U) x cooling coil area (A)

sysVar.name: CCBootLeakage
sysVar.description: Percent of air pressure loss for pneumatic control valve, valve is normally open

sysVar.name: CCFouledCoil
sysVar.description: Percent of cooling exchange capacity reduced by coil fouling

sysVar.name: CCObstructedPipe
sysVar.description: Percent of the open valve water flow reduced by the obstructed pipe. The obstruction is in between the pump and the control valve

sysVar.name: CCUndersizedCoil
sysVar.description: Undersized Cooling Coil

sysVar.name: CCLeakyValve
sysVar.description: Effective valve stem position (percent open) due to leakage when commanded fully closed

sysVar.name: CCOversizedValve
sysVar.description: Ratio of the Cv (or Kv) of the oversized valve to the Cv (or Kv) of a correctly sized valve

sysVar.name: CCStuckValve
sysVar.description: The position at which the control valve stem is stuck

sysVar.name: CCmAirEnt
sysVar.description: Air flow rate through the cooling coil

sysVar.name: CCmAirLvg
sysVar.description: Air Flow Rate Leaving Cooling Coil

sysVar.name: CCmLiqbypass
sysVar.display_name: Cooling Coil Bypass Water Flow Rate
sysVar.description: Water flow rate that bypasses the cooling coil rather than flowing through it

sysVar.name: CCmLiqEnt
sysVar.description: Water flow rate through the cooling coil

sysVar.name: CCmLiqEntValve
sysVar.display_name: Water Flow Rate Entering CC Valve
sysVar.description: Water Flow Rate Entering Cooling Coil Valve, as it returns from the Cooling Coil

sysVar.name: CCmLiqLvg
sysVar.description: Water flow rate leaving the Cooling Coil (and before reaching the Cooling Coil Valve)

sysVar.name: CCmLiqLvgValve
sysVar.display_name: Cooling Coil Primary Water Flow Rate
sysVar.description: Water flow rate through the common port of the three port control valve, equal to the sum of the coil water flow rate and the bypass water flow rate

sysVar.name: CCpos
sysVar.description: Demanded position of cooling coil control valve actuator, in the range 0-1.

sysVar.name: CCposReal
sysVar.description: Cooling Coil Valve Position (0-1) Actual position of the cooling coil control valve, in the range 0-1

sysVar.name: CCqLat
sysVar.description: Rate of latent heat transfer from water to air in the coil - heat removed from the air to dehumidify it.

sysVar.name: CCqSen
sysVar.description: Rate of sensible heat transfer from water to air in the coil - heat removed from the air to reduce its temperature

sysVar.name: CCqTot
sysVar.description: Rate of total heat transfer from water to air in the coil - sensible + latent, equals rate at which heat added to the water

sysVar.name: CCTAirEnt
sysVar.description: Dry bulb temperature of the air entering the cooling coil

sysVar.name: CCTAirLvg
sysVar.description: Dry bulb temperature of the air leaving the cooling coil

sysVar.name: CCTLiqbypass
sysVar.display_name: Water Temp in CC By Pass
sysVar.description: Water Temperature in By Pass to 3-way valve of Cooling Coil

sysVar.name: CCTLiqEntValve
sysVar.description: Water Temperature entering Valve after leaving the Coiling Coil

sysVar.name: CCTLiqLvg
sysVar.description: Temperature of water leaving the cooling coil (after the coil and before the 3-way valve)

sysVar.name: CCTLiqLvgValve
sysVar.display_name: Cooling Coil Valve Leaving Water Temperature
sysVar.description: Temperature of water leaving 3-port control valve and returning to chilled water system

sysVar.name: CCTp
sysVar.description: Supply air temperature sensor reading

sysVar.name: CCTs
sysVar.description: Supply air temperature set-point, applied to cooling coil control loop

sysVar.name: CCTwAirEnt
sysVar.display_name: Cooling Coil Entering Air Wet Bulb Temperature
sysVar.description: Wet bulb temperature of air entering cooling coil

sysVar.name: CCTwAirLvg
sysVar.display_name: Cooling Coil Leaving Air Wet Bulb Temperature
sysVar.description: Wet bulb temperature of the air leaving the cooling coil

sysVar.name: CCwAirEnt
sysVar.display_name: Cooling Coil Entering Air Humidity Ratio
sysVar.description: Humidity ratio of air entering cooling coil

sysVar.name: CCwAirLvg
sysVar.display_name: Cooling Coil Leaving Air Humidity Ratio
sysVar.description: Humidity ratio of air leaving cooling coil

sysVar.name: CCwTAirEnt
sysVar.description: Air absolute humidity ratio Entering

sysVar.name: Fanbias
sysVar.description: Control signal to the fan if there is no difference between the set-point and the actual value of the supply air static pressure. The signal to the fan can be forced by setting the gains to zero and setting the bias to the desired output

sysVar.name: Fanfr
sysVar.description: Controller is forward acting (1) or reverse acting (0)

sysVar.name: FanKd
sysVar.description: derivative constant

sysVar.name: FanKi
sysVar.description: Determines how quickly the control signal changes in response to a persistent difference between the set-point and the actual value of the supply air temperature. The larger the Integral gain, the faster the control signal changes.

sysVar.name: FanKp
sysVar.description: Proportional gain determines the size of the immediate response of the control signal to a difference between the set-point and the actual value of the supply air static pressure. The larger the Proportional Gain, the larger the change in the control sign

sysVar.name: FanmAirLvg
sysVar.description: Air flow rate leaving the supply fan

sysVar.name: FanmAirMax
sysVar.description: Maximum air flow rate through fan

sysVar.name: FanpStat
sysVar.description: Supply fan static pressure set-point

sysVar.name: FanBadFanRotationDir
sysVar.description: Incorrect rotation direction or wrong fan installed

sysVar.name: FanFanTooSmall
sysVar.description: Undersized fan

sysVar.name: FanStuckFanSpeed
sysVar.description: Fan speed stuck at specified intermediate value

sysVar.name: FanTotFanFailure
sysVar.description: Complete failure e.g. seized, broken belt, power tripped

sysVar.name: FanWrongFanType
sysVar.description: Wrong type of fan

sysVar.name: FanFailedFanSensor
sysVar.description: Sensor offset/failure

sysVar.name: FanRangeErrorVFD
sysVar.description: Range error in variable-frequency drive

sysVar.name: FanDeafVFDorIGV
sysVar.description: VFD or inlet guide vanes fail to respond to changing control signal

sysVar.name: FaneffShaft
sysVar.description: Supply Fan efficiency

sysVar.name: FanmAirEnt
sysVar.description: Air flow rate entering the supply fan

sysVar.name: FannCon
sysVar.description: Demanded fan speed as a fraction of maximum speed (1000 rpm)

sysVar.name: FannReal
sysVar.description: Actual fan speed as a fraction of maximum speed (1000 rpm)

sysVar.name: Fanp
sysVar.description: Total pressure rise across supply fan

sysVar.name: FanpowerTot
sysVar.description: Supply fan motor electric power consumption

sysVar.name: FanpStatMea
sysVar.description: Output of the static pressure sensor in the supply duct, including the effect of calibration error and time lag.

sysVar.name: FanpStatReal
sysVar.description: Actual value of the static pressure in the supply duct

sysVar.name: FanTAirEnt
sysVar.description: Dry bulb temperature of air entering the supply fan

sysVar.name: FanTAirLvg
sysVar.description: Dry bulb temperature of air leaving the supply fan

sysVar.name: FanTp
sysVar.description: Static pressure sensor reading

sysVar.name: FanTwAirEnt
sysVar.description: Air Wet Bulb Temperature Entering the Supply Fan

sysVar.name: FanTwAirLvg
sysVar.description: Air Wet Bulb Temperature Leaving the Supply Fan

sysVar.name: FanwAirEnt
sysVar.display_name: Humidity Ratio of Air Entering Fan
sysVar.description: Humidity ratio of air entering fan

sysVar.name: FanwAirLvg
sysVar.display_name: Humidity Ratio of Air Leaving Fan
sysVar.description: Humidity ratio of air leaving fan

sysVar.name: MXbias
sysVar.description: Control signal to the mixing box dampers if there is no difference between the set-point and the actual value of the supply air temperature. The signal to the valve can be forced by setting the gains to zero and setting the bias to the desired output

sysVar.name: MXfr
sysVar.description: Specifies whether the economizer controller is forward acting (1) or reverse acting (0). If the control is reverse acting, the outside air damper opens when the supply air temperature needs to decrease, which is what is required if Tout is less than Tret

sysVar.name: MXKd
sysVar.description: Derivative gain

sysVar.name: MXKi
sysVar.description: Determines how quickly the control signal changes in response to a persistent difference between the set-point and the actual value of the supply air temperature. The larger the Integral Gain, the faster the control signal changes.

sysVar.name: MXKp
sysVar.description: Proportional gain determines the size of the immediate response of the control signal to a difference between the set-point and the actual value of the supply air temperature. The larger the Proportional Gain, the larger the change in the control signal.

sysVar.name: MXTRet
sysVar.description: Actual value of the temperature of the return air from the rooms

sysVar.name: MXTwRet
sysVar.description: Wet bulb temperature of the return air entering the mixing box

sysVar.name: MXDeafActuator
sysVar.description: Actuators fail to respond to changing control signal

sysVar.name: MXReverseActionAct
sysVar.description: Damper and actuator mismatch

sysVar.name: MXStuckActuator
sysVar.description: Outside air and exhaust air dampers fixed in the specified position (X%) and the return air damper fixed at (100-X)%. Most commonly due to a single actuator being used for all three dampers and the actuator or one of the dampers being stuck.

sysVar.name: MXBadPosOADamper
sysVar.description: Incorrect minimum position of outdoor air damper

sysVar.name: MXLeakOADamper
sysVar.description: Leakage of outside air damper

sysVar.name: MXStuckOADamper
sysVar.description: Outside or exhaust dampers stuck

sysVar.name: MXLeakRetDamper
sysVar.description: Leakage of return air damper

sysVar.name: MXBadSensor
sysVar.description: Sensor offset/failure

sysVar.name: MXMismatchDampAct
sysVar.description: Hysteresis in actuator(s) or damper linkage(s)

sysVar.name: MXEAPosDamper
sysVar.description: Demanded position of exhaust air damper in mixing box

sysVar.name: MXEAPosDamperReal
sysVar.description: Actual position of the exhaust air damper in the mixing box, in the range 0-1

sysVar.name: MXOAPosDamper
sysVar.description: Demanded position of outside air damper in mixing box

sysVar.name: MXOAPosDamperReal
sysVar.description: Actual position of the outside air damper in the mixing box (0-1)

sysVar.name: MXPos
sysVar.description: Output of the economizer controller (0-1) - used to determine the demanded positions of the mixing box dampers.

sysVar.name: MXRAPosDamper
sysVar.description: Demanded position of return air damper in mixing box, in the range 0-1.

sysVar.name: MXRAPosDamperReal
sysVar.description: Actual position of the outside air damper in the mixing box (0-1)

sysVar.name: MXTmix
sysVar.description: Mixed air temperature sensor reading - includes sensor drift and time lag.

sysVar.name: MXTMixReal
sysVar.description: Actual value of the mixed air temperature

sysVar.name: MXTOut
sysVar.description: Actual value of the outside air temperature

sysVar.name: MXTp
sysVar.description: Value of mixed air temperature sensor reading

sysVar.name: MXTs
sysVar.description: Set-point for the economizer controller, which controls the temperature of the air leaving the mixing box.

sysVar.name: MXTwmix
sysVar.description: Wet bulb temperature of the air leaving the mixing box

sysVar.name: MXTwOut
sysVar.description: Wet bulb temperature of the outside air entering the mixing box

sysVar.name: VAVbias
sysVar.description: Control signal to the reheat coil valve if there is no difference between the set-point and the actual value of the room air temperature. The signal to the valve can be forced by setting the gains to zero and setting the bias to the desired output

sysVar.name: VAVDAMPbias
sysVar.description: Control signal to the VAV damper if there is no difference between the set-point and the actual value of the air flow rate. The signal to the damper can be forced by setting the gains to zero and setting the bias to the desired output

sysVar.name: VAVDAMPfr
sysVar.description: Specifies whether the VAV damper controller is forward acting (1) or reverse acting (0). If the control is reverse acting, the VAV damper opens when the room air temperature needs to decrease.

sysVar.name: VAVDAMPKd
sysVar.description: VAV damper derivative gain

sysVar.name: VAVDAMPKi
sysVar.description: Determines how quickly the control signal to the VAV damper changes in response to a persistent difference between the set-point and the actual value of the VAV box air flow rate. The larger the Integral Gain, the faster the control signal changes.

sysVar.name: VAVDAMPKp
sysVar.description: Proportional gain determines the size of the immediate response of the control signal to a difference between the set-point and the actual value of the VAV box air flow rate. The larger the Proportional Gain, the larger the change in the control signal.

sysVar.name: VAVfr
sysVar.description: Specifies whether the room temperature controller is forward acting (1) or reverse acting (0). If the control is forward acting, the reheat coil valve opens when the room air temperature needs to increase.

sysVar.name: VAVHCmLiqOpen
sysVar.display_name: Reheat Coil Maximum Water Flow Rate
sysVar.description: Water flow rate through the reheat coil when the control valve is fully open

sysVar.name: VAVHCStatus
sysVar.description: Heating coil running status (on/off)

sysVar.name: VAVHCTLiqEnt
sysVar.description: Temperature of water entering the reheat coil

sysVar.name: VAVHCTs
sysVar.description: Room temperature set-point, applied to reheat coil control loop

sysVar.name: VAVHCUA
sysVar.description: Reheat coil overall heat transfer coefficient (U) x reheat coil area (A) - determined from rated duty and rated log mean temperature difference from manufacturer's data

sysVar.name: VAVKd
sysVar.description: Derivative gain

sysVar.name: VAVKi
sysVar.description: Determines how quickly the control signal to the VAV box changes in response to a persistent difference between the set-point and the actual value of the room temperature. The larger the Integral Gain, the faster the control signal changes.

sysVar.name: VAVKp
sysVar.description: Proportional gain determines the size of the immediate response of the control signal to a difference between the set-point and the actual value of the room temperature. The larger the Proportional Gain, the larger the change in the control signal.

sysVar.name: VAVposMin
sysVar.description: Minimum position of the VAV box damper to provide the minimum flow rate required for the room.

sysVar.name: VAVDeafActuator
sysVar.description: Actuators fail to respond to changing control signal

sysVar.name: VAVHCBootLeakage
sysVar.description: Percent of air pressure loss for pneumatic control valve, valve is normally open

sysVar.name: VAVHCFouledCoil
sysVar.description: Percent of heat exchange capacity reduced by coil fouling

sysVar.name: VAVHCObstructedPipe
sysVar.description: Percent of the open valve water flow reduced by the obstructed pipe. The obstruction is in between the pump and the control valve

sysVar.name: VAVHCUndersizedCoil
sysVar.description: Undersized Coil

sysVar.name: VAVBadDmprPosSignal
sysVar.description: Fault indicator of damper position

sysVar.name: VAVBadMinPosDamper
sysVar.description: Incorrect minimum position of air damper

sysVar.name: VAVLeakyDamper
sysVar.description: Damper leakage

sysVar.name: VAVStuckDamper
sysVar.description: Position at which the VAV box damper is stuck (0-1, 0=closed, 1=fully open)

sysVar.name: VAVBadFlowerMeas
sysVar.display_name: VAV Box Air Flow Calibration Error
sysVar.description: Calibration offset error in fraction for the air flow rate sensor in the VAV box

sysVar.name: VAVTooHighInletAirSP
sysVar.description: Inlet air static pressure too high

sysVar.name: VAVTooLowInletAirSP
sysVar.display_name: Inlet air static pressure too low
sysVar.description: Inlet air static pressure too low

sysVar.name: VAVBadLoopTune
sysVar.description: Poor loop tuning of VAV box controller

sysVar.name: VAVBadReheatCoil
sysVar.description: Faulty reheating coil (same as coil section above)

sysVar.name: VAVHCDriftedsensor
sysVar.description: Sensor has drifted some number of degress

sysVar.name: VAVHCLeakyValve
sysVar.description: Effective valve stem position (percent open) due to leakage when commanded fully closed

sysVar.name: VAVHCOversizedValve
sysVar.description: Ratio of the Cv (or Kv) of the oversized valve to the Cv (or Kv) of a correctly sized valve.

sysVar.name: VAVHCStuckValve
sysVar.description: The position at which valve is stuck.

sysVar.name: VAVBoxTooBig
sysVar.description: Oversized VAV box

sysVar.name: VAVBoxTooSmall
sysVar.description: Undersized VAV box

sysVar.name: VAVBadZoneMeas
sysVar.description: Offset in room temperature sensor reading due to calibration error

sysVar.name: VAVDAMPos
sysVar.description: Demanded position of the VAV box damper(0=closed, 1=fully open)

sysVar.name: VAVDAMPTp
sysVar.display_name: VAV Box Air Flow Rate Sensor
sysVar.description: Reading of the VAV box air flow rate sensor

sysVar.name: VAVDAMPTr
sysVar.description: Air flow rate through the VAV box

sysVar.name: VAVDAMPTs
sysVar.description: Set-point for the VAV damper controller, which varies the damper position in order to maintain the air flow rate at the set-point. THIS VALUE IS GENERATED BY THE ROOM TEMPERATURE CONTROLLER AND CANNOT BE SET BY THE USER.

sysVar.name: VAVHCmAirEnt
sysVar.description: Air flow rate through the reheat coil

sysVar.name: VAVHCmAirLvg
sysVar.description: Air flow rate leaving the Heating Coil

sysVar.name: VAVHCmLiqbypass
sysVar.display_name: Reheat Coil Bypass Water Flow Rate
sysVar.description: Water flow rate that bypasses the reheat coil rather than flowing through it.

sysVar.name: VAVHCmLiqEnt
sysVar.description: Water flow rate through the reheat coil

sysVar.name: VAVHCmLiqEntValve
sysVar.display_name: Reheat Coil Primary Water Flow Rate
sysVar.description: Water flow rate through the common port of the reheat coil three port control valve, equal to the sum of the coil water flow rate and the bypass water flow rate

sysVar.name: VAVHCmLiqLvg
sysVar.description: Water flow rate leaving the Heating Coil (and before reaching the 3-way valve)

sysVar.name: VAVHCmLiqLvgValve
sysVar.display_name: Reheat Coil Water Flow Rate Leaving Valve
sysVar.description: Water flow rate leaving the reheat coil 3-way valve (and returning back to the hot water system)

sysVar.name: VAVHCpos
sysVar.description: Demanded position of reheat coil control valve actuator, in the range 0-1.

sysVar.name: VAVHCposReal
sysVar.description: Actual position of the reheat coil control valve, in the range 0-1

sysVar.name: VAVHCq
sysVar.description: Rate of heat transfer from water to air in the reheat coil

sysVar.name: VAVHCTAirEnt
sysVar.description: Dry bulb temperature of the air entering the reheat coil

sysVar.name: VAVHCTAirLvg
sysVar.description: Dry bulb temperature of the air leaving the reheat coil

sysVar.name: VAVHCTLiqbypass
sysVar.description: Temperature of water by-passing the reheat coil

sysVar.name: VAVHCTLiqEntValve
sysVar.description: Water Temperature entering 3-way valve (returning from Heating Coil)

sysVar.name: VAVHCTLiqLvg
sysVar.description: Temperature of water leaving the reheat coil (after the coil and before the 3-way valve)

sysVar.name: VAVHCTLiqLvgValve
sysVar.display_name: Reheat Coil Valve Leaving Water Temperature
sysVar.description: Reheat Coil Valve Leaving Water Temperature Temperature of water leaving 3-port control valve and returning to hot water system

sysVar.name: VAVHCTp
sysVar.description: Value of the room temperature sensor

sysVar.name: VAVHCTwAirEnt
sysVar.display_name: Reheat Coil Entering Air Wet Bulb Temperature
sysVar.description: Wet bulb temperature of air entering reheat coil

sysVar.name: VAVHCTwAirLvg
sysVar.display_name: Reheat Coil Leaving Air Wet Bulb Temperature
sysVar.description: Wet bulb temperature of air leaving reheat coil

sysVar.name: VAVHCwAirEnt
sysVar.display_name: Reheat Coil Entering Air Humidity Ratio
sysVar.description: Humidity ratio of air entering reheat coil

sysVar.name: VAVHCwAirLvg
sysVar.display_name: Reheat Coil Leaving Air Humidity Ratio
sysVar.description: Humidity ratio of air leaving reheat coil

sysVar.name: VAVm
sysVar.description: Air flow rate into the room from the VAV box

sysVar.name: VAVPos
sysVar.description: Position of the damper in the VAV box (0=closed, 1=fully open).

sysVar.name: VAVpre
sysVar.display_name: Air pressure in front of the VAV box
sysVar.description: Air pressure in front of the VAV box

sysVar.name: FltLeakyFilter
sysVar.description: Leakage through or around

sysVar.name: FltPartlyClogged
sysVar.description: Partially clogged

sysVar.name: FltBadDPSensor
sysVar.description: Incorrect/mal functioning DP sensor

sysVar.name: FltmAirEnt
sysVar.description: Air mass flow rate

sysVar.name: FltmAirLvg
sysVar.description: Air filter mass flow rate leaving filter

sysVar.name: FltpreDrop
sysVar.description: air pressure drop across the filter

sysVar.name: PAtm
